Try this sauce with our dinner-served-cold recipes: salmon, lamb, chicken, or beef.IngredientsMakes about 2 cups6Tbsp. fresh lemon juice1garlic clove, finely grated1tsp. kosher salt1tsp. freshly ground black pepper2cups plain whole-milk Greek yogurtPreparationStep 1Whisk lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper into yogurt in a medium bowl to evenly distribute.Step 2Do Ahead: Sauce can be made 1 day ahead. Cover and chill.How would you rate Lemony Yogurt Sauce?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (1)Back to TopTriangleI've been making yogurt at home, so I'm enjoying experimenting with all different things to make with my yogurt. This is a real crowd pleaser and spruces up so many types of dishes. I made it in bulk (6 cups of yogurt), and it was really heavy on the lemon juice if I followed the recipe. I reduced to about 4.5 Tbsp per 2 cups and got a very lemony, delicious result.AnonymousDenver, CO7/16/2020Explore Bon AppétitSauceCondimentLemonCitrusFruitYogurtOther IngredientsQuickEasyGluten-FreeNut-FreeVegetarianKetoRecipes you want to make.
